byline.contributor: Richard Fausset contributed reporting from Dallas, and David Montgomery from Austin, Tex.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ, ALAN BLINDER and JULIE TURKEWITZ

abstract: Look back at shootings of police officers in Dallas on July 7 highlights how confusion associated with fog of war, complete with improvisation by officers under fire, and chance decisions can place both police and civilians in harm's way; gunman Micah X Johnson had prowled stealthily for almost six hours while shooting and killing police.
lead_paragraph: Amid the chaos of gunfire, there was confusion akin to the fog of war, improvisation under fire and acts of bravery to shield loved ones and strangers alike.

headline.main: As Dallas Sniper Prowled, Quick Decisions and Life-Altering Consequences
headline.print_headline: The Fog of War, Unfolding in Dallas Streets

snippet: Amid the chaos of gunfire, there was confusion akin to the fog of war, improvisation under fire and acts of bravery to shield loved ones and strangers alike....
